CSSView-timeline-axis.summary: The view-timeline-axis CSS property is used to specify the scrollbar direction that will be used to provide the timeline for a named view progress timeline animation, which is progressed through based on the change in visibility of an element (known as the subject) inside a scrollable element (scroller). view-timeline-axis is set on the subject. See CSS scroll-driven animations for more details.

blockquote.para: Note: If the scroller element does not overflow its container in the axis dimension or if the overflow is hidden or clipped, no scroll progress timeline will be created.

remarks.para: The view-timeline-axis and view-timeline-name properties can also be set using the view-timeline shorthand property.
